ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to shape my actions towards others, leading me away from humble service and towards prideful self-exaltation?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Have I made accumulation of material possessions and wealth a driving force in my life, causing me to put them above God's providence and blessings?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question:
Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence? 

In considering this question I am reminded that believing one’s blessings are due to one’s own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I allowed my desire for entertainment and leisure to take precedence over my financial obligations, potentially jeopardizing my ability to provide for myself and others in need?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, through conversations or social media, potentially harming their reputations for my own entertainment or satisfaction?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I spoken badly about others, taking pleasure in discussing their private affairs even if what I shared was true?

anger.question: Have I nursed anger in my thoughts, allowing resentment to simmer rather than seeking reconciliation in my relationships?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
